intro: Amesia gigantea, commonly known as the giant fleabane, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white to pale pink petals and yellow centers, blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed, contributing to its distinctive scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry meadows and rocky habitats. Amesia gigantea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
